bibl.title: Sam Gum v. Henry M. White. Bail Bond
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States, for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Application of SAM GUM, for Writ of Habeas Corpus.

WHEREAS, SAM GUM, in person and by and through his attorney, John J. Sullivan, filed an application in the above entitled court for a writ of habeas corpus, and an order to show cause was issued, and a stipulation was entered into between Robert C. Saunders, United States District Attorney, and John J. Sullivan, Attorney for said Petitioner, that said hearing on the merits of said application and Petition pending a decision of the Circuit Court of Appeals in the cases of United States vs Seid Yam and Chung Him, and whereas pending said hearing on said merits in this case the above entitled court has required the said Sam Gum, Petitioner, to be enlarged upon furnishing a bail bond in the sum of One Thousand Dollars ($1,000.00) secured by Liberty Bonds in the said sum of One Thousand Dollars ($1,000.00) for the appearance of said Sam Gum in the above entitled court, at the call of said court;

NOW, THEREFORE, know all men by these presents, that Sam Gum, as principal, has caused to be deported with the clerk of the above entitled court, the sum of One Thousand Dollars ($1,000.00) in Liberty Bonds of the United States, as surety, is held and firmly bound unto the United States, in the penal sum of One Thousand Dollars ($1,000.00), as designated by the deposit of said One Thousand Dollars ($1,000.00) in Liberty Bonds of the United States Government, as surety, for the payment of which, well and truly to be made, he binds himself, his heirs, executors, administrators and assigns, jointly and severally, by these presents.
Sealed with his seals and dated this 28th day of

The condition of the above obligation is such that if the above mentioned Sam Gum shall at all times render himself amenable to the orders and processes of the above entitled court, and will appear for judgment in case it be ultimately determined that the said Petitioner is not entitled to a writ of Habeas corpus and is remanded to the custody of the Commissioner of Immigration at Seattle, Washington, then this obligation to be void; otherwise to remain in full force and effect.
Filed in the United States District Court
